des:
Smitch skill lets you control all your electrical appliances through voice.

You’ll need to use the My Smitch app for iOS or Android to connect your Smitch devices to your home WiFi network and give them distinct names. Once done, head to the Smart Home section in the Alexa app, select “Enable Smart Home Skills”, search for the Smitch skill and press “Enable Skill”. 

Once your Smitch account is verified and linked to your Alexa profile, you can discover your devices by saying, “Alexa, discover my devices” or running a device discovery in the Smart Home screen of the Alexa app.

To control your devices, say “Alexa turn on/off my <device name> <switch name>.” You can also create groups of other ON/OFF devices in the Alexa app to control together.

Here are some of trivial phrases to get started:

“Alexa, turn on the lights”
“Alexa, set Kitchen lights to 50%”*
"Alexa, turn off Living Room"

*The device must support the percentage control option.

PREREQUISITES
Smitch Control devices should be installed and configured.

For more information please visit http://www.mysmitch.com
